intro: Hylodesmum podocarpum f. album, commonly known as the white-flowered hylodesmum, is a rare and distinctive member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its pale or white flowers, which contrast with its dark green foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are finely divided and have a strong aromatic scent, typical of many members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
